thread.title: PrepXtra football picks: Week 7
thread.title_full: PrepXtra football picks: Week 7 - PrepXtra Story

author: knoxnews.com
title: PrepXtra football picks: Week 7
text:
Campbell County (4-2, 2-0 Region 3-5A) at Farragut (5-0, 2-0): Farragut jumped to No. 3 and received one first-place vote in this week's Class 5A poll after being idle in Week 6. Yep, the Admirals have had an extra week to prepare for Campbell County's Josh Lay, who has led the Cougars to four straight wins and put up video game-like numbers since being inserted as starting quarterback. Farragut will counter with a stout defense, led by Chattanooga commitment Cole Strange (64 tackles, 12 TFL, four sacks), that's allowing only 9.2 points per game this season. Admirals running back Tanner Thomas needs 192 yards to top 1,000 this season. Both should make an impact on Friday with the top spot in Region 3-5A on the line.
PrepXtra Pick: Farragut 35, Campbell County 21
Gibbs (3-3, 1-1 Region 2-5A) at Halls (2-3, 1-1): The rivalry doesn't get the same praise as others in the area, but its one of the most passionate, regardless if Gibbs and Halls play every year. And there's plenty at stake on Friday, particularly a step toward the playoffs. Halls, which last advanced to the postseason in 2007, is convinced the turnover woes that plagued it early this season have been exorcised. The Red Devils have won consecutive games, albeit against winless South-Doyle and Union County, and received a boost from an improving offensive line. Gibbs has lost consecutive games, but has won the past two in the series against Halls. Keep an eye on speedy Gibbs slotback Desanta Smith.
PrepXtra Pick: Gibbs 31, Halls 24
Morristown West (5-1, 2-0 Region 1-5A) vs. Morristown East (0-5, 0-2): I know how this matchup looks on paper. I also know that few rivalries carry this much clout in their communities. Morristown West, ranked No. 2 in Class 5A, is technically the home team, though both teams call Burke-Toney Stadium "home." The Trojans have won five consecutive games since losing a heartbreaker to Fulton in Week 1. Morristown East, meanwhile, has shown its potential in spurts this season, though its record has been muddied by a bevy of injuries and a brutal schedule. Morristown West, which has won 16 of the past 19, represents the final leg of the tough stretch, and nothing would jump start the Hurricanes' late playoff run like upsetting its biggest rival on Friday. East is as healthy as it has been since Week 1, but West, led by running back DeAndre Delaney, still might be too big an obstacle.
PrepXtra Pick: Morristown West 35, Morristown East 24
Catholic (2-4, 0-2 Region 2-4A) at Anderson County (3-3,1-1): It's crunch time for Catholic's football team. The Irish need to win two of their final three region games to advance to the postseason. Anderson County, which rallied to stun rival Clinton last week, presents the first test, and has a running game, led by sophomore Mason Phillips, capable of giving any defense problems. Still, Catholic showed flashes of its potential in a Week 5 loss to Fulton, the first game back for standout Irish receiver Chase Kuerschen. Expect quarterback Chase Cunningham to find him and Southern California commitment Amari Rodgers often on Friday.
PrepXtra Pick: Catholic 42, Anderson County 31
